elections.title: UENR SRC GENERAL ELECTIONS 2025
elections.description: University-wide elections for the Student Representative Council (SRC), aimed at selecting committed student leaders to represent the entire student body, promote transparency, and enhance student engagement in university governance.

positions.title: SRC President
positions.description: The overall student leader responsible for representing all students of UENR, leading initiatives to improve campus life, fostering collaboration among student groups, and acting as a liaison between students and the university administration.

candidates.bio: CS Level 1 student, tech enthusiast with a passion for digital innovation and student empowerment. Experienced in organizing tech workshops and hackathons within the university.
candidates.manifesto: Together for a Digital UENR: I will leverage technology to increase student participation in governance, improve communication channels, and create digital platforms for feedback and collaboration.

candidates.bio: CS Level 4 student, peer mentor, and active volunteer in student welfare programs. Skilled in project coordination and leading team-based initiatives.
candidates.manifesto: Unity Through Service: My goal is to strengthen student unity by promoting inclusive activities, mentorship programs, and community outreach projects to enhance student welfare.

positions.title: SRC General Secretary
positions.description: Handles official correspondence, manages records, and ensures proper documentation of SRC activities, while maintaining effective communication between students and the SRC leadership team.

candidates.bio: Final year CS student with excellent organizational skills and experience in administrative coordination within student clubs and projects.
candidates.manifesto: Better Communication, Better Records: I will implement streamlined communication systems and transparent documentation practices to ensure students are well-informed and engaged in SRC decisions.

elections.title: SCHOOL OF SCIENCES GENERAL ELECTIONS 2025
elections.description: Elections to choose student leaders for the School of Sciences, focusing on enhancing student engagement, academic support, and representation of the school at university-wide platforms.

positions.title: School President
positions.description: Coordinates student leadership activities within the School of Sciences, represents the school in university-wide councils, and promotes academic excellence, welfare, and innovation among students.

candidates.bio: Nursing Level 2 student, passionate about student welfare and academic development. Actively engages in peer counseling and student mentoring programs.
candidates.manifesto: Welfare and Academic Balance: I will introduce support programs, academic resources, and wellness initiatives to ensure students thrive both academically and socially.

candidates.bio: IT Level 1 student, focused on innovation and promoting practical learning opportunities for students. Experienced in leading tech projects and student clubs.
candidates.manifesto: Innovation and Growth: I aim to create platforms for student innovation, workshops, and research collaborations to foster academic growth and creativity.

positions.title: School Secretary
positions.description: Responsible for record-keeping, managing documentation, and assisting the School President in coordinating activities across the School of Sciences.

candidates.bio: Nursing Level 2 student, detail-oriented and skilled in administration. Experienced in managing student club records and event coordination.
candidates.manifesto: Accurate Records for an Organized School: I will ensure proper documentation of school activities, timely communication, and efficient record-keeping practices.

elections.title: COMPUTER SCIENCE GENERAL ELECTIONS 2025
elections.description: Department-level elections for the Computer Science department, aiming to select student leaders who will enhance departmental activities, academic excellence, and student participation.

positions.title: Department President
positions.description: Leads student initiatives within the Computer Science department, represents the department in academic and administrative meetings, and promotes teamwork, mentorship, and innovation.

candidates.bio: CS Level 4 student, skilled in leadership and project management, with experience in organizing coding competitions and departmental workshops.
candidates.manifesto: Transforming CS through Collaboration: I will create mentorship programs, collaborative projects, and workshops to strengthen student engagement and skills development.

candidates.bio: CS Level 4 student, passionate about representing student interests and ensuring their voices are heard in departmental decisions.
candidates.manifesto: A Stronger CS Voice: I aim to advocate for student needs, enhance academic support, and implement initiatives that empower students in their career paths.

positions.title: Department Organizer
positions.description: Coordinates departmental events, workshops, and student activities, ensuring smooth execution and active participation from students.

candidates.bio: CS student actively involved in organizing coding bootcamps, workshops, and departmental events to enhance learning experiences.
candidates.manifesto: More Coding Sessions and Career Events: I will organize practical sessions, industry collaborations, and events to provide real-world exposure to students.

elections.title: AGRIBUSINESS DEPARTMENT ELECTIONS 2025
elections.description: Department-level elections for Agribusiness Management and Consumer Studies, aimed at selecting leaders who will improve student engagement, organize practical learning experiences, and represent the department effectively.

positions.title: Department President
positions.description: Head student leader in Agribusiness Management, responsible for coordinating departmental events, facilitating student participation, and promoting academic and professional development.

candidates.bio: Agribusiness Level 3 student, dedicated to improving student support and practical learning experiences. Actively participates in departmental projects and mentorship programs.
candidates.manifesto: Practical Agribusiness Experiences: I will introduce hands-on workshops, field projects, and networking opportunities to enhance learning and professional readiness.

elections.title: NURSING DEPARTMENT ELECTIONS 2024
elections.description: Elections for the Nursing Department student leadership (previous cycle), aiming to choose representatives who will advocate for student welfare, support academic development, and enhance clinical learning opportunities.

positions.title: Department President
positions.description: Leads the Nursing Department students, coordinates welfare initiatives, promotes peer mentorship, and represents student concerns in departmental discussions.

candidates.bio: Nursing student passionate about clinical excellence and student mentorship. Engaged in academic support programs and practical skill workshops.
candidates.manifesto: Bridging Theory and Practice: I will ensure that students have access to practical clinical experiences alongside academic learning, enhancing overall competence.

candidates.bio: Nursing student focused on student mentorship, welfare, and academic guidance. Experienced in coordinating peer support programs.
candidates.manifesto: Peer Mentorship for Academic Excellence: I will establish structured mentorship systems to help students excel academically and professionally.
